## ERROR TIPS

### Power System Placement Issues
- Steam engines cannot be placed on water tiles - verify terrain before placement
- Maintain proper spacing (2 tiles) between boiler and steam engine
- Check for existing entities before placing new components

### Boiler Placement Problems
- Ensure boilers are placed on land, not water
- Verify clear space in all directions when placing boilers
- Check for existing entities that might block placement

### Water Source Verification
- Always verify water exists at target location before placing offshore pump
- Use get_resource_patch() to confirm water availability
- Offshore pumps must be placed directly adjacent to water

### Component Connection Issues
- Ensure all power plant components are properly connected with pipes
- Verify steam engine placement aligns with boiler output direction
- Check that all components are on the same power network

### Placement Direction Considerations
- Pay attention to entity facing directions when placing
- Ensure steam engine placement aligns with boiler output direction
- Verify pipe connections match component orientations

### Power Network Verification
- Check that all electrical consumers are connected to power poles
- Verify steam engines show WORKING status
- Monitor power production vs consumption

### Entity Collision Prevention
- Maintain sufficient spacing between power plant components
- Check for existing entities before placement attempts
- Consider using grid-aligned placement coordinates
